Talk_07:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Well, ahem, if I'm honest, even an expert
like me doesn't know EXACTLY what
gloom really is.
The Depthsâ€”you know the Depths, don't
you? The vast, dark expanse that these
chasms lead to?
<snd:Sad_00>Anyway, one can find gloom all over the
Depths. It emerges from these chasms to
taint the surface.
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Just<clr:0000> touching it will steal your vitality<clr:ffff>, so
watch out. Dreadful stuff.

*sigh* Unfortunately, that's about as far
as my research has taken me.
Talk_55:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:SurpriseS>The inn owner? <sp:5:1:0>Ah, the spacy-looking
fellow.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0500>He made the beds recently, but I haven't
seen him since.
Talk_30:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>You again?! I told you not to startle me!


<clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000>That was dangerous. I almost lost my balance.<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>
Talk_08:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Well, what is it? I'm busy. Unless you
have questions for a <clr:0000>gloom specialist<clr:ffff>,
that is...
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I suppose I could make time for that.
Talk_56:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Perhaps he went to that tent over there?
He said he'd have an easy time finding it
because of the bizarre ruins on the spot.
Talk_57:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I wonder if he made it. It looked like he
was about to fall asleep.
Talk_45: <sp:3:0:2:0900>You again?! I told you not to startle me!<sp:0:4:0><clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000>I almost fell in this strong wind we're getting.<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>
Talk_46:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Yes? What is it?<sp:0:4:0>It's very risky to be standing here with
the strong wind coming in from the chasm
right now.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01>Haven't you heard the legend that strong
winds like these happen because there's
a dragon nearby?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700>Haha! Just kidding, of course. But I do
wonder why you keep talking to me.<sp:0:4:0>Do you really have that much to ask
a <clr:0000>gloom specialist<clr:ffff>?
Talk_34:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>You again?! I told you not to startle me!


<clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000>That was dangerous. I almost lost my balance.
With all this rain, I couldn't hear a thing.<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>
Talk_36:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Don't sneak up on me!


<clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000>Yikes. That was close. I almost fell in this strong
wind we're getting.<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>
Talk_10:
<sp:3:0:2:0400>Oh, wait...


<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy>I heard all about your assistance with
Tauro's ruins investigation!

Now, what brings you here? Have you
come for a professional consultation on
<clr:0000>gloom<clr:ffff>, perhaps?
Talk_37:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c00>My grandma told me a story once about when she
was traveling through the Eldin mountain range in
the north, long ago.<sp:0:4:0>The wind grew fierce, and when she looked up at
the sky, she thought she saw something flying.<sp:0:4:0>Could it be...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_01:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c00>To think that a <clr:0000>chasm<clr:ffff> would open so close to a
village. This warrants constant observation.

<clr:0000>Xalis <clr:ffff>is leading the Ring Ruins investigation, so
that leaves me free to focus on <clr:0000>gloom<clr:ffff>...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_27:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c00>Once the Ring Ruins investigation is finished, I can
always return to my study of the Depths...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_50:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c00>The wind suddenly picked up. Is there something
going on nearby? I don't know what could cause it.

Though I did once hear a legend that there are
dragons in this world. It couldn't be that...<sp:5:0:0>could it?

No, no. I mustn't let a little wind spook me.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Don't startle me!


<clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000>Phew. That was close. I could have fallen.<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>
Talk_28:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive>Eh? You were just sneaking about with no
good reason? That...<sp:5:0:0>that...

<sp:3:0:2:0900>You can't do that! <sp:5:0:0>I almost fell, you know!
Talk_51:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c00>My mom did tell me a story once about when she
was traveling through the Faron Grasslands to the
south, long ago.<sp:0:4:0>The wind grew fierce, and when she looked up at
the sky, she thought she saw something flying.<sp:0:4:0>Could it be...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_29:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Don't sneak up on me!


<clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000>Yikes. That was close. With all this rain, I couldn't
hear a thing.<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>
Talk_03:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughL>Eh? What's this? Are you asking because
you're planning a trip down the <clr:0000>chasm<clr:ffff>?
What bravery!
If you touch <clr:0000>gloom <clr:ffff>and become unwell,
<clr:0000>come to the surface<clr:ffff> right away. <sp:5:1:0>That's the
most important thing.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Certain <clr:0000>foods<clr:ffff> may help. I did feel better
when I tried nibbling a <clr:0000>yellow plant <clr:ffff>I
found near some fallen ruins...
<snd:Think_01>I tried researching the plant to confirm my
results, but I can't find any records of it.

<sp:0:2:2:5000>Come to think of it, I heard <clr:0000>Cori<clr:ffff> discovered
<clr:0000>a new species of plant<clr:ffff>. Perhaps I'll ask her.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_17:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I'm busy, but since you helped Tauro, I'll
hear you out.

Ah, or perhaps you have questions for a
<clr:0000>gloom specialist<clr:ffff>...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>I suppose I could make time for that.
Talk_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS>Asking questions about <clr:0000>gloom<clr:ffff> while
other folks are drawn to the <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff>...

The Zonai Survey Team could use
inquisitive minds like yours.
Talk_06:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>I'm a <clr:0000>specialist in gloom<clr:ffff>, not defying
gravity! One false step and that's the end
of my research.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Now, what brings you here? Have you
come for a professional consultation on
<clr:0000>gloom<clr:ffff>, perhaps?
